response.overview: Once, Joop Korzelius was a celebrated jazz drummer, earning heaps of money and having rows of girls chasing after him. Now, the 84-year-old has been living for years in what he jokingly calls the "Army of Hell." In the documentary 'I Was Already Famous Then,' we see a content Joop on screen, calmly smoking among the outcasts. He talks about his performance at the Royal Palace when Prince Bernhard still played a bit. The contrast between his life then and now could hardly be greater.
response.tagline: From Jazz Drums to Outcast Charms: Joop Korzelius' Unforgettable Journey
response.title: Toen was ik al beroemd
